title: B2B Integration into MMKC 2.0 (Interims Solution)
description:
Description
General Information
With MaxDOT SME+ customers will find a new home in MMKC 2.0 maintained by B2C. As the development is still ongoing, the implementation of B2B customer needs for mobile contracts will be delayed to at least 2026. As the SME+ customers will already land within MMKC as they login, they are unable to use the native journeys for contract prolongation or tariff change as they are only available for B2C customers as of now. As an interims solution they should use the standard B2B system which has B2B contract specifications available. To make this as seemless as possible, the process should be integrated into MMKC 2.0 without jumping full into the other system.
  Business Epic Nutzenstatement
Für bestehende SME+ Mobilfunkkunden,
die Self-Service nutzen und im MMKC 2.0 angemeldet sind,
ist die Anbindung/ Integration Standard-B2B-Order-Systemen an MMKC 2.0 notwendig,
wodurch Kunden deren Funktionalität integriert (ohne dass der Absprung an der Stelle bemerkt wird) nutzen können,
so dass  sie Verträge verlängern oder Tarife ändern können,
und nicht zum Wettbewerb wechseln.
Das Vorhaben schafft erhöhte Kundenzufriedenheit und hilft zum Cross Selling.
  For existing SME+ B2B mobile customers,
who use self-service and are logged into MMKC 2.0
is a connection/integration the standard B2B ordering system to MMKC 2.0 necessary,
so that customers can use theses functionalities
to perform contract prolongation or tariff change
and do not churn to competitors.
This issue increases customer satisfaction and helps with cross-selling.

Business Scope:
Interims solution for B2B mobile journeys which are not available on OneX platforms in 2025

business_impact.cost_saving: Savings due to self service instead of customer service activities
business_impact.risk_loss: the additional churn risk is not rated
business_impact.justification: Savings due to self service instead of customer service activities; the additional churn risk is not rated.

strategic_enablement.justification: We need to safeguard the SME+ mobile business growth in the B2B systems until the DOT readiness. The existing sub-level model must continue to operate within MBSP and other B2B systems due to DOT's limited implementation scope. That avoids customer and revenue move from B2B to B2C. Especially mobile revenues are counted via product category, not customer segment. Therefore we have the risk, that without additional invest in up- and cross sell customers can´t be developed in the right direction.

time_criticality.justification: The integration of mobile B2B business for SME+ customers into DOT systems has been delayed to 2026. As a result, the existing B2B systems remain the home base not only for SME customers that do not migrate to DOT at all but also for SME+ customers with B2B mobile contracts in 2025. The implementation of the requirement in MMKC (dependencies) has already been planned for PI 25.2 (or later).

acceptance_criteria: A seamless journey is provided to MMKC2.0 and MMA by the standard B2B system.
Redirected users are logged into the standard system via SSO
All native journeys from the standard system can be used, especially contract prolongation and tariff change
Invoices are available and ready to download
The user should not be lead to the dashboard nor recognize a redirection to another system at all
A return button is displayed on each page so that the user can return to MMKC at any time.
No menu, footer etc. from the standard system shall be displayed on the page so that the user does not realise that he is in a different system
The standard system provides everything needed for the acceptance criteria mentioned above regarding the customer experince within MMKC 2.0
